title: Mussels in a rich tomato sauce
description: Let them think you made an effort...
instructions: Scrub the mussels clean under cold running water, pulling away their beards and scraping off any barnacles, and place the clean mussels in a bowl. If any are open, tap them briskly on the side of the sink. If they don't shut, or any mussels are damaged, discard them.
Heat the olive oil in a large, wide saucepan. Gently fry the onions, garlic, and chilli for about 10 minutes or until they are soft and golden.
Meanwhile place the tomatoes in a bowl, cover with boiling water, and leave to soak for a minute or two.
Drain, peel, and roughly chop the tomatoes, removing the seeds. Try and keep as much of the juice as you can.

Once the onions are soft, stir in the tomato flesh and any reserved juice. Increase the heat slightly and cook the tomato, stirring regularly, until the mixture has reduced to a thick but textured sauce. Keep warm.
Pour 150ml cold water into a large saucepan. Bring the water to the boil, and add a single layer of the mussels.
Cover and bring back to the boil. As soon as the mussels open - about 2 minutes - remove them with a slotted spoon so that the liquid is left in the saucepan. Repeat until all the mussels are cooked.
Add a couple of large spoonfuls of mussel water to the tomato sauce and season with black pepper.
Heat the sauce so it's piping hot. Add the mussels, then re-heat and serve immediately.
imageDesc: A dinner bowl filled with open mussels, cooked in tomato sauce
